ETYMOLOGY: From Old Norse steik ('a roast'), related to steikja ('to roast on a spit').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n.: noun; a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A slice of meat, especially beef, cut from the fleshy part of the animal and usually cooked by grilling or frying.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一片肉，尤指牛肉，从动物身体的肉质部分切下，通常通过烤或煎来烹制。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She ordered a juicy T-bone steak for dinner, cooked rare.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她晚餐点了一份多汁的T骨牛排，要三分熟的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n.: noun; a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A thick slice of fish or a large slice of vegetable, prepared in a similar way to a meat steak.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一大片鱼肉或蔬菜，以类似于肉排的方式烹制。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We enjoyed grilled salmon steaks with a side of roasted vegetables.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们享用了烤三文鱼排和一份烤蔬菜。
